body_html:
@avmgithub I just tried reproducing this on one of our ppc64le machines but I wasn't able to get this error. tbb has come out with a new release at the end of March. I'll send a PR to update the submodule.

I'm running ubuntu xenial with kernel release '4.4.0-104-generic'. I installed miniconda2.7 for power8. I ran the following commands

export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="$(dirname $(which conda))/../"
conda install numpy pyyaml setuptools cmake cffi typing
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt install g++
git submodule update --init
CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER=/usr/bin/g++ CMAKE_C_COMPILER=/usr/bin/gcc python setup.py build_deps develop
python test/test_nn.py TestNN.test_Softmax2d

Some more info

ubuntu@pytorch-2:~/pytorch$ g++ --version
g++ (Ubuntu/IBM 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
Copyright (C) 2015 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

ubuntu@pytorch-2:~/pytorch$ python test/test_nn.py TestNN.test_Softmax2d
.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 1.713s

OK

ubuntu@pytorch-2:~/pytorch$ printf "#include <gnu/libc-version.h> \n #include <cstdio> \n int main() { printf(\"GNU libc version: %%s \\\n\", gnu_get_libc_version());}" | g++ -std=c++11 -x c++ - && ./a.out
GNU libc version: 2.23

body:
@avmgithub I just tried reproducing this on one of our ppc64le machines but I wasn't able to get this error. tbb has come out [with a new release](https://github.com/01org/tbb/releases) at the end of March. I'll send a PR to update the submodule.

I'm running ubuntu xenial with kernel release '4.4.0-104-generic'. I installed [miniconda2.7 for power8](https://conda.io/miniconda.html). I ran the following commands

```
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="$(dirname $(which conda))/../"
conda install numpy pyyaml setuptools cmake cffi typing
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt install g++
git submodule update --init
CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER=/usr/bin/g++ CMAKE_C_COMPILER=/usr/bin/gcc python setup.py build_deps develop
python test/test_nn.py TestNN.test_Softmax2d
```

Some more info

```
ubuntu@pytorch-2:~/pytorch$ g++ --version
g++ (Ubuntu/IBM 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
Copyright (C) 2015 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
```

```
ubuntu@pytorch-2:~/pytorch$ python test/test_nn.py TestNN.test_Softmax2d
.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 1.713s

OK
```

```
ubuntu@pytorch-2:~/pytorch$ printf "#include <gnu/libc-version.h> \n #include <cstdio> \n int main() { printf(\"GNU libc version: %%s \\\n\", gnu_get_libc_version());}" | g++ -std=c++11 -x c++ - && ./a.out
GNU libc version: 2.23
```
